The Elder Aṅkola Flower
“My name was Nārada,
and I was known as Kassapa.
I saw the foremost of ascetics,
Vipaśyin, honored by the gods.
The Buddha, who bears the major marks,
the receiver of offerings,
I raised up an aṅkola flower
and offered it to the Buddha.
For ninety-one eons
I made an offering of that flower.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
For seventy-four eons
there was a noble warrior named Romsa.
He wore garlands and ornaments,
